title: Prince Harry had a secret pocket added to his wedding outfit for vital task
text:

Prince Harry stood proudly at his big brother William's side as he said his wedding vows and made Kate Middleton his wife.

The two men both looked smart and handsome in their red, black and gold military uniforms, which were specially made for the historical day.

However Harry had an alteration made to his Household Cavalry's Blues and Royals outfit, asking for a secret pocket to be sewn in.

Tailor Kashket & Partners, who made both Harry and William's outfits as well as the page boys' outfits, accepted the challenge and their clever work meant the small compartment attached to the golden cuff was impossible to see.

Harry wanted the pocket to make sure one of his most important jobs of the day went down without a hitch - and it worked a treat.

(Image: PA)

It is customary for the best man to carry the ring in his trouser or jacket pocket but Harry's slimline suit made this impossible.

This meant he needed somewhere else to put the welsh gold ring William would place on Kate's finger during the ceremony.

A spokesman for Kashket & Partners said: "Harry, aware that he would be waving to the crowds, feared he may drop the ring and wanted a secret compartment.

"The royal brothers wanted the day to run effortlessly smoothly and decided this would be the best option."

Harry's proved to be the perfect choice when it came to William's best man, and he also delivered a moving speech at the private evening reception.

(Image: PA)

(Image: AFP)

He also acted as Master of Ceremonies and took to his feet in front of 350 of the couple’s closest friends and ­family.

According to guests, there was barely a dry eye as Harry turned to William and told him: “Our mother would be so very proud of you.”

A source revealed: “Harry only said a few words, but it was so emotional. The entire room burst into applause.”

Wearing a fez hat Harry had started his speech by standing on the top table and describing the newlyweds as the “Dude and Duchess”.

(Image: AFP/Getty Images)

(Image: Mike Moore)

As guests chuckled, he poked fun at William’s ­receding hairline and said he felt sorry for Kate marrying a “bald man”.

He handed over to two of William’s oldest pals, who cracked jokes that had him ­laughing hysterically.

Double act James Meade, who William, 28, met at Eton, and Thomas Van Straubenzee, a friend from William’s Ludgrove Prep School in ­Berkshire, ­recounted tales of William’s ­“debauchery” and “nakedness” as a ­bachelor.

Finally, proud father of the bride Michael Middleton, 61, was ­greeted with a standing ovation for a speech which captured the ­spirit of the day.

He told the guests: “Today was everything I had hoped for and I’m thrilled that equality ruled the day. Everybody appears as equal and our two families joining ­together has been an easy process. I thank the Royal Family for welcoming us as easily as they have.”
description: Prince Harry had a lot of important jobs on the day his brother Prince William married the love of his life Kate Middleton at Westminster Abbey
